 over time. As long as the server communicates the templates - like URIs - =

> >

sers support templated URIs, e.g. for search engines. By typing a keyword, =

> >

> Hi Jakob,
> 
> URI templates are fine, as long as the=
 specification of the parameters is 'global' (not just defined by the serve=
r for the sake of it's own API).
> 
> My preference is to define the parame=
ters as part of the specification of the link relation that is used with th=
e template. Such a link relation specification must include two things:
> 
=
> 1) It must specifiy that the URI references used are to be interpreted as=
 templates (because a template URI is a valid URI and you cannot tell the d=
ifference if you do not know up front that you are given a template URI ref=
erence).
> 
> 2) What parameters the client might encounter and what they m=
ean.
> 
> An example of this is the opensearch specification[1].
> 
> Jan
